Posts.Title: Feeling alone...and facing a new reality Sonata rosasmommy

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2015 03:59PM LoriKnous wrote: Hello ladies, I haven't been on the sight in a very long time. My mets was found in March of 2012, and the original dx was in April of 2007. I'm ER/PR- and Her2+ so i'v been on Herceptin and Perjeta since then with a lil zometa thrown in every 3 mo. Thankfully they have kept things from progressing any further at this point.
Posts.Title: How Many Are We? DivineMrsM kt1966

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2013 12:46PM LoriKnous wrote: Such good news. I'm thinking that this is going to be my next option if my H/P combo fails me. Optomisim, I just keep positive about all of this, and keep livin' every day.
Posts.Title: TDM1 Gets approved!!! ango74 usafmom

Posts.Content: LoriKnous wrote: Hello ladies, I was diagnosed in 2007 with what my surgeon called "ductal carsinoma w/lobular features" I chose to have AC for 12 weeks and Taxol for 12 weeks, mastectomy with no node involvment and then radiation. I am also Her2+ so Herceptin was on board as well for a year. I thought all was well and was reaching my 5 year mark In March of this year they found that I have a "mass" that they confirmed was mets to my ovary/bladder w/acities to my abdomen/lungs. I did go with 6 rounds of taxol/carboplatin/herceptin and now I am on herceptin/perjeta/zometa for as long as it works. I am finding it to be a strange reoccurance and little to no info about how this progression works. The onc says he makes no promises after 2 years but, right now I feel pretty good. Dx 4/8/2007, IDC, 5cm, Stage IB, Grade 3, 0/12 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Dx 3/17/2012, IDC, <1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/12 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Chemotherapy 4/8/2012 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxol (paclitaxel) Targeted Therapy 8/14/2012 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Targeted Therapy 9/23/2012 Perjeta (pertuzumab) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Breast cancer mets to my ovary/bladder LoriKnous LoriKnous

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2012 09:03PM LoriKnous wrote: Thanks for your many words LuAnnH.  I guess we'll see just what comes in the scans since the tx. As I said, I do feel pretty good and I surely feel and plan on much more than 2 years. I know there are always new treatments and I am open to any they want to throw my way. I had always said I wanted to live to 100. I may not get there but, i'm gettin' as close as i possibly can.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer mets to my ovary/bladder LoriKnous LoriKnous

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2013 04:25PM LoriKnous wrote: I was looking online for info about a new drug "Perjeta" and ended up asking CTCA. They responded with "where do you live and what insurance do you have" At that point I explained I was on disability and my health care at present was medicaid. The response was, "I'm sorry we can't help you but, we can direct you to someone in your area".  Wow, I thought. All I needed was some information about a new drug. If you don't have the right insurance OH WELL, not even information!
